application

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object

    Controller

    The controller event handler methods declared as public so they can be set or invoked by the loader

    Note: The Controller class contains the following methods: public void initialize() void onActionBtn(ActionEvent event) void onMouseDrag(MouseEvent event) void HideALl()

    Since:
    2020-11-15
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mike Hodges

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Is run first and is used to set up the initial setting. Set the urlStr to "https://www.gutenberg.org/files/1065/1065-h/1065-h.htm" as the default Load the initial HTML instruction to the user. Set the visibility of the various elements.

      • onActionBtn

        void onActionBtn(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        onActionBtn runs every time any of the buttons are clicked. The buttons name is striped from the event and used as a switch in the case statement. The case statement then show or hide various elements. The case statement calls TextAnalyzer LinkedHashMap String, Long htmlStringToFreqMap(String str) and converts the output to a chart. This should be cleaned up at a future date by adding a few methods.
        Parameters:
        event - Takes a button click event

      • onMouseDrag

        void onMouseDrag(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)

      • HideAll

        void HideAll()
        Hideall basically resets everything by setting all element to not visible.
